compsim_pinns.elasticity package¶

Submodules¶

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils module¶

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.apply_zero_neumann_x_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces x component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in x direction.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network input

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network output

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tx – x component of traction vector

Return type:

torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.apply_zero_neumann_y_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces y component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in y direction.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network input

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network output

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Ty – y component of traction vector

Return type:

torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.apply_zero_neumann_z_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces z component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in z direction.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network input

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network output

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tz – z component of traction vector

Return type:

torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.calculate_traction_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network input

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network output

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

  • Tx (any) – Traction components in cartesian x direction

  • Ty (any) – Traction components in cartesian y direction

  • Tn (any) – Traction components in polar n (normal) direction

  • Tt (any) – Traction components in polar t (tangential) direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.elastic_strain_2d(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the strain tensor components for plane stress condition in 2D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tf)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tf)) – contains the placeholder for network output

Returns:

  • sigma_xx (Placeholder (tf)) – xx component of stress tensor

  • sigma_yy (Placeholder (tf)) – yy component of stress tensor

  • sigma_xy (Placeholder (tf)) – xy component of stress tensor

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.elastic_strain_rate_3d(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the strain tensor components in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output

Returns:

  • eps_xx_rate (tensor) – contains the xx components of strain rate tensor in 3D

  • eps_yy_rate (tensor) – contains the yy components of strain rate tensor in 3D

  • eps_zz_rate (tensor) – contains the zz components of strain rate tensor in 3D

  • eps_xy_rate (tensor) – contains the xy components of strain rate tensor in 3D

  • eps_yz_rate (tensor) – contains the yz components of strain rate tensor in 3D

  • eps_xz_rate (tensor) – contains the xz components of strain rate tensor in 3D

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_elastic_strain_3d(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the strain tensor components in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output

Returns:

  • eps_xx (tensor) – contains the xx components of strain tensor in 3D

  • eps_yy (tensor) – contains the yy components of strain tensor in 3D

  • eps_zz (tensor) – contains the zz components of strain tensor in 3D

  • eps_xy (tensor) – contains the xy components of strain tensor in 3D

  • eps_yz (tensor) – contains the yz components of strain tensor in 3D

  • eps_xz (tensor) – contains the xz components of strain tensor in 3D

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_plane_strain_stress_rate_coupling(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses based on linear isotropic material law and predicted displacements in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

  • term_x_velocity (tensor) – difference between predicted velocity and calulated velocity in x direction

  • term_y_velocity (tensor) – difference between predicted velocity and calulated velocity in y direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_stress_coupling(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses based on linear isotropic material law and predicted displacements in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

  • term_xx (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xx component in 3D

  • term_yy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yy component in 3D

  • term_zz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in zz component in 3D

  • term_xy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xy component in 3D

  • term_yz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yz component in 3D

  • term_xz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xz component in 3D

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_stress_rate_coupling_3d(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses based on linear isotropic material law and predicted displacements in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

  • term_xx_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xx component

  • term_yy_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in yy component

  • term_zz_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in zz component

  • term_xy_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xy component

  • term_yz_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in yz component

  • term_xz_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xz component

Calculates the stress tensor components in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output

Returns:

  • sigma_yy (tensor) – contains the yy components of stress tensor in 3D

  • sigma_zz (tensor) – contains the zz components of stress tensor in 3D

  • sigma_xy (tensor) – contains the xy components of stress tensor in 3D

  • sigma_yz (tensor) – contains the yz components of stress tensor in 3D

  • sigma_xz (tensor) – contains the xz components of stress tensor in 3D

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_2d_spacetime(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation. Note that this method works only if space-time domain (dde.geometry.GeometryXTime) is generated.

yPlaceholder (tensor)

contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy

Xnumpy.ndarray

Network input as numpy array (x,y,t)

Returns:

  • Tx (any) – Traction components in cartesian x direction

  • Ty (any) – Traction components in cartesian y direction

  • Tn (any) – Traction components in polar n (normal) direction

  • Tt (any) – Traction components in polar t (tangential) direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_2d_time(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in 2D mixed formulation with time. Note that this method works only if the generated GMSH geometry is 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array (x,y,t)

Returns:

  • Tx (any) – Traction components in cartesian x direction

  • Ty (any) – Traction components in cartesian y direction

  • Tn (any) – Traction components in polar n (normal) direction

  • Tt (any) – Traction components in polar t (tangential) direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_3d(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network input

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network output

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

  • Tx (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Traction components in cartesian x direction

  • Ty (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Traction components in cartesian y direction

  • Tz (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Traction components in cartesian z direction

  • Tn (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Traction components in polar n (normal) direction

  • Tt_1 (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Traction components in polar t_1 (tangential) direction

  • Tt_2 (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Traction components in polar t_2 (tangential) direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_3d_spacetime(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points an time: x, y, z, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array (x,y,z,t)

Returns:

  • Tx (tensor) – Traction components in cartesian x direction

  • Ty (tensor) – Traction components in cartesian y direction

  • Tz (tensor) – Traction components in cartesian z direction

  • Tn (tensor) – Traction components in polar n (normal) direction

  • Tt_1 (tensor) – Traction components in polar t_1 (tangential) direction

  • Tt_2 (tensor) – Traction components in polar t_2 (tangential) direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.lin_iso_elasticity_plane_strain(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses based on linear isotropic material law and predicted displacements in plane strain condition.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the input arguments

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the network output

Returns:

  • term_xx (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xx component

  • term_yy (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for yy component

  • term_xy (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xy component

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the input arguments

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the network output

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_3d(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for PDE of the mixed-variable formulation in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

  • momentum_x (tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_y (tensor) – momentum terms in y based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_z (tensor) – momentum terms in z based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xx component in 3D

  • term_yy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yy component in 3D

  • term_zz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in zz component in 3D

  • term_xy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xy component in 3D

  • term_yz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yz component in 3D

  • term_xz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xz component in 3D

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_3d_time(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for PDE of the mixed-variable formulation in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points an time: x, y, z, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

  • momentum_x (tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_y (tensor) – momentum terms in y based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_z (tensor) – momentum terms in z based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xx component in 3D

  • term_yy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yy component in 3D

  • term_zz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in zz component in 3D

  • term_xy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xy component in 3D

  • term_yz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yz component in 3D

  • term_xz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xz component in 3D

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_strain(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for pde of the mixed-variable formulation in case of plane strain.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the input arguments

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the network output

Returns:

  • momentum_x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – momentum terms in y based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xx component

  • term_yy (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for yy component

  • term_xy (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xy component

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_strain_time_dependent(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and displacements. It generates the terms for pde of the displacement-stress mixed-variable formulation in case of plane strain for elastodynamics.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: c

Returns:

  • momentum_x (tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_y (tensor) – momentum terms in y based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xx component

  • term_yy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for yy component

  • term_xy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xy component

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_stress(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for pde of the mixed-variable formulation in case of plane stress.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the input arguments

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the network output

Returns:

  • momentum_x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xx component

  • term_yy (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for yy component

  • term_xy (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xy component

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_stress_time_dependent(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and displacements. It generates the terms for pde of the displacement-stress mixed-variable formulation in case of plane stress.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy

Returns:

  • momentum_x (tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_y (tensor) – momentum terms in y based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xx component

  • term_yy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for yy component

  • term_xy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses for xy component

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_velocity_3d_time(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for PDE of the mixed-variable formulation in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points an time: x, y, z, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

  • momentum_x (tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_y (tensor) – momentum terms in y based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_z (tensor) – momentum terms in z based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xx component

  • term_yy_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in yy component

  • term_zz_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in zz component

  • term_xy_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xy component

  • term_yz_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in yz component

  • term_xz_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xz component

  • term_x_velocity (tensor) – difference between predicted velocity and calulated velocity in x direction

  • term_y_velocity (tensor) – difference between predicted velocity and calulated velocity in y direction

  • term_z_velocity (tensor) – difference between predicted velocity and calulated velocity in z direction

  • term_xx (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xx component

  • term_yy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yy component

  • term_zz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in zz component

  • term_xy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xy component

  • term_yz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yz component

  • term_xz (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xz component

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_velocity_plane_strain_time_dependent(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and velocity fields. It generates the terms for pde of the displacement-velocity mixed-variable formulation in case of plane strain for elastodynamics. Additionally, it couples the velocity fields with displacements.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy, velocity_x, velocity_y

Returns:

  • momentum_x (tensor) – momentum terms in x based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • momentum_y (tensor) – momentum terms in y based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_xx_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xx component

  • term_yy_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in yy component

  • term_xy_rate (tensor) – difference between predicted stress rates and calculated stress rates in xy component

  • term_x_velocity (tensor) – difference between predicted velocity and calulated velocity in x direction

  • term_y_velocity (tensor) – difference between predicted velocity and calulated velocity in y direction

  • term_xx (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xx component

  • term_yy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in yy component

  • term_xy (tensor) – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in xy component

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.problem_parameters()[source]¶

Calculates the elastic properties for given Lame and shear modulus.

Returns:

  • nu (float) – Poisson’s ratio

  • lame (float) – Lame parameter

  • shear (float) – Shear modulus

  • e_modul (float) – Young’s modulus

  • y (Placeholder (tf)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy, velocity_x, velocity_y

Returns:

  • sigma_xx (Placeholder (tf)) – xx component of stress tensor

  • sigma_yy (Placeholder (tf)) – yy component of stress tensor

  • sigma_xy (Placeholder (tf)) – xy component of stress tensor

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.stress_to_traction_2d(sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy, normals, cond)[source]¶

Calculates the traction components in cartesian (x,y) and polar coordinates (n (normal) and t (tangential)).

Parameters:

  • sigma_xx (any) – Stress component in x direction

  • sigma_yy (any) – Stress component in y direction

  • sigma_xy (any) – Stress component in xy direction (shear)

  • normals (vector) – Normal vectors

  • cond (boolean) – Dimensions of stresses and and normals have to match. Normals are calculated on the boundary, while stresses are calculated everywhere.

Returns:

  • Tx (any) – Traction components in cartesian x direction

  • Ty (any) – Traction components in cartesian y direction

  • Tn (any) – Traction components in polar n (normal) direction

  • Tt (any) – Traction components in polar t (tangential) direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.stress_to_traction_3d(sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_xz, sigma_yz, normals, tangentials_1, tangentials_2, cond)[source]¶

Calculates the traction components in Cartesian (x, y, z) and polar coordinates (n and t) in 3D.

Parameters:

  • sigma_xx (any) – Stress component in the x direction

  • sigma_yy (any) – Stress component in the y direction

  • sigma_zz (any) – Stress component in the z direction

  • sigma_xy (any) – Shear stress component in the xy plane

  • sigma_xz (any) – Shear stress component in the xz plane

  • sigma_yz (any) – Shear stress component in the yz plane

  • normals (numpy.ndarray) – Normal vectors

  • tangentials_1 (numpy.ndarray) – Tangential vectors in the first coordinate direction

  • tangentials_2 (numpy.ndarray) – Tangential vectors in the second coordinate direction

  • cond (boolean) – Dimensions of stresses and normals have to match. Normals are calculated on the boundary, while stresses are calculated everywhere.

Returns:

  • Tx (any) – Traction components in cartesian x direction

  • Ty (any) – Traction components in cartesian y direction

  • Tz (any) – Traction components in cartesian z direction

  • Tn (any) – Traction components in polar n (normal) direction

  • Tt_1 (any) – Traction components in polar t_1 (tangential) direction

  • Tt_2 (any) – Traction components in polar t_2 (tangential) direction

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.zero_neumann_x_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces x component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in x direction.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network input

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network output

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tx – x component of traction vector

Return type:

any

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.zero_neumann_y_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces y component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in y direction.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network input

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – Network output

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Ty – y component of traction vector

Return type:

any

compsim_pinns.elasticity.elasticity_utils.zero_neumman_plane_strain_x(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates x component of the homogeneous Neumann BC.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

Tx – x component of the homogeneous Neumann BC

Return type:

torch.Tensor or tf.Tensor
